page.title: 02PHYSICAL GEOGRAPHY
page.content: This is an area of hills, valleys, woods and heathland, but you can also see where humans have been at work! Between Bramley and Wonersh there is the Bramley stream, a tributary of the Wey which is just outside our area. There are extensive mature woodland areas characterised by oak, beech and coniferous plantations.Grassy farmland is found where the soil is neither to sandy or too chalky. The predominance of natural woodland and the continuing existence of the more traditional small fields with trees and hedgerows create, not only a variety of landscapes, but also an intimate human scale where there can be sympathy between land use, landscape, the countryside dweller and the recreationalist.
